Then Shephatiah<S>8203</S> the son<S>1121</S> of Mattan<S>4977</S>, and Gedaliah<S>1436</S> the son<S>1121</S> of Pashur<S>6583</S>, and Jucal<S>3116</S> the son<S>1121</S> of Shelemiah<S>8018</S>, and Pashur<S>6583</S> the son<S>1121</S> of Malchiah<S>4441</S>, heard<S>8085</S> the words<S>1697</S> that Jeremiah<S>3414</S> had spoken<S>1696</S> unto all the people<S>5971</S>, saying<S>559</S>,
Thus saith<S>559</S> the LORD<S>3068</S>, He that remaineth<S>3427</S> in this city<S>5892</S> shall die<S>4191</S> by the sword<S>2719</S>, by the famine<S>7458</S>, and by the pestilence<S>1698</S>: but he that goeth forth<S>3318</S> to the Chaldeans<S>3778</S> shall live<S>2421</S>; for he shall have his life<S>5315</S> for a prey<S>7998</S>, and shall live<S>2421</S> <S>2425</S>.
Thus saith<S>559</S> the LORD<S>3068</S>, This city<S>5892</S> shall surely<S>5414</S> be given<S>5414</S> into the hand<S>3027</S> of the king<S>4428</S> of Babylon's<S>894</S> army<S>2428</S>, which shall take<S>3920</S> it.
Therefore the princes<S>8269</S> said<S>559</S> unto the king<S>4428</S>, We beseech thee, let this man<S>376</S> be put to death<S>4191</S>: for thus<S>3651</S> he weakeneth<S>7503</S> the hands<S>3027</S> of the men<S>582</S> of war<S>4421</S> that remain<S>7604</S> in this city<S>5892</S>, and the hands<S>3027</S> of all the people<S>5971</S>, in speaking<S>1696</S> such words<S>1697</S> unto them: for this man<S>376</S> seeketh<S>1875</S> not the welfare<S>7965</S> of this people<S>5971</S>, but the hurt<S>7451</S>. <sup>welfare: Heb. peace</sup>
Then Zedekiah<S>6667</S> the king<S>4428</S> said<S>559</S>, Behold, he is in your hand<S>3027</S>: for the king<S>4428</S> is not he that can<S>3201</S> do any thing<S>1697</S> against you.
Then took<S>3947</S> they Jeremiah<S>3414</S>, and cast<S>7993</S> him into the dungeon<S>953</S> of Malchiah<S>4441</S> the son<S>1121</S> of Hammelech<S>4428</S>, that was in the court<S>2691</S> of the prison<S>4307</S>: and they let down<S>7971</S> Jeremiah<S>3414</S> with cords<S>2256</S>. And in the dungeon<S>953</S> there was no water<S>4325</S>, but mire<S>2916</S>: so Jeremiah<S>3414</S> sunk<S>2883</S> in the mire<S>2916</S>. <sup>of Hammelech: or, of the king</sup>
Now when Ebedmelech<S>5663</S> the Ethiopian<S>3569</S>, one<S>376</S> of the eunuchs<S>5631</S> which was in the king's<S>4428</S> house<S>1004</S>, heard<S>8085</S> that they had put<S>5414</S> Jeremiah<S>3414</S> in the dungeon<S>953</S>; the king<S>4428</S> then sitting<S>3427</S> in the gate<S>8179</S> of Benjamin<S>1144</S>;
Ebedmelech<S>5663</S> went forth<S>3318</S> out of the king's<S>4428</S> house<S>1004</S>, and spake<S>1696</S> to the king<S>4428</S>, saying<S>559</S>,
My lord<S>113</S> the king<S>4428</S>, these men<S>582</S> have done evil<S>7489</S> in all that they have done<S>6213</S> to Jeremiah<S>3414</S> the prophet<S>5030</S>, whom they have cast<S>7993</S> into the dungeon<S>953</S>; and he is like to die<S>4191</S> for<S>6440</S> hunger<S>7458</S> in the place<S>8478</S> where he is: for there is no more bread<S>3899</S> in the city<S>5892</S>. <sup>he is like: Heb. he will die</sup>
Then the king<S>4428</S> commanded<S>6680</S> Ebedmelech<S>5663</S> the Ethiopian<S>3569</S>, saying<S>559</S>, Take<S>3947</S> from hence thirty<S>7970</S> men<S>582</S> with thee<S>3027</S>, and take up<S>5927</S> Jeremiah<S>3414</S> the prophet<S>5030</S> out of the dungeon<S>953</S>, before he die<S>4191</S>. <sup>with thee: Heb. in thine hand</sup>
So Ebedmelech<S>5663</S> took<S>3947</S> the men<S>582</S> with him<S>3027</S>, and went<S>935</S> into the house<S>1004</S> of the king<S>4428</S> under the treasury<S>214</S>, and took<S>3947</S> thence old<S>1094</S> cast clouts<S>5499</S> and old<S>1094</S> rotten rags<S>4418</S>, and let them down<S>7971</S> by cords<S>2256</S> into the dungeon<S>953</S> to Jeremiah<S>3414</S>.
And Ebedmelech<S>5663</S> the Ethiopian<S>3569</S> said<S>559</S> unto Jeremiah<S>3414</S>, Put<S>7760</S> now these old<S>1094</S> cast clouts<S>5499</S> and rotten rags<S>4418</S> under thine armholes<S>679</S> <S>3027</S> under the cords<S>2256</S>. And Jeremiah<S>3414</S> did<S>6213</S> so.
So they drew up<S>4900</S> Jeremiah<S>3414</S> with cords<S>2256</S>, and took him up<S>5927</S> out of the dungeon<S>953</S>: and Jeremiah<S>3414</S> remained<S>3427</S> in the court<S>2691</S> of the prison<S>4307</S>.
Then Zedekiah<S>6667</S> the king<S>4428</S> sent<S>7971</S>, and took<S>3947</S> Jeremiah<S>3414</S> the prophet<S>5030</S> unto him into the third<S>7992</S> entry<S>3996</S> that is in the house<S>1004</S> of the LORD<S>3068</S>: and the king<S>4428</S> said<S>559</S> unto Jeremiah<S>3414</S>, I will ask<S>7592</S> thee a thing<S>1697</S>; hide<S>3582</S> nothing from me. <sup>third: or, principal</sup>
Then Jeremiah<S>3414</S> said<S>559</S> unto Zedekiah<S>6667</S>, If I declare<S>5046</S> it unto thee, wilt thou not surely<S>4191</S> put me to death<S>4191</S>? and if I give thee counsel<S>3289</S>, wilt thou not hearken<S>8085</S> unto me?
So Zedekiah<S>6667</S> the king<S>4428</S> sware<S>7650</S> secretly<S>5643</S> unto Jeremiah<S>3414</S>, saying<S>559</S>, As the LORD<S>3068</S> liveth<S>2416</S>, that made<S>6213</S> us this soul<S>5315</S>, I will not put thee to death<S>4191</S>, neither will I give<S>5414</S> thee into the hand<S>3027</S> of these men<S>582</S> that seek<S>1245</S> thy life<S>5315</S>.
Then said<S>559</S> Jeremiah<S>3414</S> unto Zedekiah<S>6667</S>, Thus saith<S>559</S> the LORD<S>3068</S>, the God<S>430</S> of hosts<S>6635</S>, the God<S>430</S> of Israel<S>3478</S>; If thou wilt assuredly<S>3318</S> go forth<S>3318</S> unto the king<S>4428</S> of Babylon's<S>894</S> princes<S>8269</S>, then thy soul<S>5315</S> shall live<S>2421</S>, and this city<S>5892</S> shall not be burned<S>8313</S> with fire<S>784</S>; and thou shalt live<S>2421</S>, and thine house<S>1004</S>:
But if thou wilt not go forth<S>3318</S> to the king<S>4428</S> of Babylon's<S>894</S> princes<S>8269</S>, then shall this city<S>5892</S> be given<S>5414</S> into the hand<S>3027</S> of the Chaldeans<S>3778</S>, and they shall burn<S>8313</S> it with fire<S>784</S>, and thou shalt not escape out<S>4422</S> of their hand<S>3027</S>.
And Zedekiah<S>6667</S> the king<S>4428</S> said<S>559</S> unto Jeremiah<S>3414</S>, I am afraid<S>1672</S> of the Jews<S>3064</S> that are fallen<S>5307</S> to the Chaldeans<S>3778</S>, lest they deliver<S>5414</S> me into their hand<S>3027</S>, and they mock<S>5953</S> me.
But Jeremiah<S>3414</S> said<S>559</S>, They shall not deliver<S>5414</S> thee. Obey<S>8085</S>, I beseech thee, the voice<S>6963</S> of the LORD<S>3068</S>, which I speak<S>1696</S> unto thee: so it shall be well<S>3190</S> unto thee, and thy soul<S>5315</S> shall live<S>2421</S>.
But if thou refuse<S>3986</S> to go forth<S>3318</S>, this is the word<S>1697</S> that the LORD<S>3068</S> hath shewed<S>7200</S> me:
And, behold, all the women<S>802</S> that are left<S>7604</S> in the king<S>4428</S> of Judah's<S>3063</S> house<S>1004</S> shall be brought forth<S>3318</S> to the king<S>4428</S> of Babylon's<S>894</S> princes<S>8269</S>, and those women shall say<S>559</S>, Thy friends<S>582</S> <S>7965</S> have set thee on<S>5496</S>, and have prevailed<S>3201</S> against thee: thy feet<S>7272</S> are sunk<S>2883</S> in the mire<S>1206</S>, and they are turned away<S>5472</S> back<S>268</S>. <sup>Thy friends: Heb. Men of thy peace</sup>
So they shall bring out<S>3318</S> all thy wives<S>802</S> and thy children<S>1121</S> to the Chaldeans<S>3778</S>: and thou shalt not escape out<S>4422</S> of their hand<S>3027</S>, but shalt be taken<S>8610</S> by the hand<S>3027</S> of the king<S>4428</S> of Babylon<S>894</S>: and thou shalt cause this city<S>5892</S> to be burned<S>8313</S> with fire<S>784</S>. <sup>thou shalt cause: Heb. thou shalt burn, etc</sup>
Then said<S>559</S> Zedekiah<S>6667</S> unto Jeremiah<S>3414</S>, Let no man<S>376</S> know<S>3045</S> of these words<S>1697</S>, and thou shalt not die<S>4191</S>.
But if the princes<S>8269</S> hear<S>8085</S> that I have talked<S>1696</S> with thee, and they come<S>935</S> unto thee, and say<S>559</S> unto thee, Declare<S>5046</S> unto us now what thou hast said<S>1696</S> unto the king<S>4428</S>, hide<S>3582</S> it not from us, and we will not put thee to death<S>4191</S>; also what the king<S>4428</S> said<S>1696</S> unto thee:
Then thou shalt say<S>559</S> unto them, I presented<S>5307</S> my supplication<S>8467</S> before<S>6440</S> the king<S>4428</S>, that he would not cause me to return<S>7725</S> to Jonathan's<S>3083</S> house<S>1004</S>, to die<S>4191</S> there.
Then came<S>935</S> all the princes<S>8269</S> unto Jeremiah<S>3414</S>, and asked<S>7592</S> him: and he told<S>5046</S> them according to all these words<S>1697</S> that the king<S>4428</S> had commanded<S>6680</S>. So they left off speaking<S>2790</S> with him; for the matter<S>1697</S> was not perceived<S>8085</S>. <sup>they: Heb. they were silent from him</sup>
So Jeremiah<S>3414</S> abode<S>3427</S> in the court<S>2691</S> of the prison<S>4307</S> until the day<S>3117</S> that Jerusalem<S>3389</S> was taken<S>3920</S>: and he was there when Jerusalem<S>3389</S> was taken<S>3920</S>.
